column1: At a moment where #COVID19 hospitalizations are up 20% from the height of spring's first wave it is crucial that we work together to ensure everyone in our community has the health care they need.    There are 21 days left to #GetCovered.   Pass it on.   https://t.co/2cmpkh9716

ATTN DuPage county: In response to the exponential spread of #COVID19 in recent weeks today @DuPageHD opened a second community-based drive-thru testing site.   The new Odeum Expo Center test site will open 10 a.m. to 6 p.m Monday - Wednesday this week https://t.co/qpM33pBeBp

Over the past few months I’ve listened to folks across our small business community tell me about their struggle to keep the doors open customers safe and employees on payroll as PPP funds run out & COVID surges.   We need relief now! https://t.co/7MKGrgb10p

Every year flu shots save lives. But this year getting your #FluShot (and getting it early) will be crucial to saving lives and ensuring our nurses and doctors can focus on fighting #COVID19.  If you haven’t already make a plan to get your flu shot ASAP and pass it on.

#COVID19 has made even clearer what’s always been true:   1. Every worker supporting our students should be able to take care of their own family.   2. Ensuring all workers have access to family and medical leave is crucial to keeping our families and our communities safe.
Grant applications are now open and require compliance with Illinois’ current #COVID19 executive order.    Apply here: https://t.co/ntt7h4BOQ1

🚨ATTN Illinoisans: Open enrollment ends in less than 1 month.  With #COVID19 cases hospitalizations and deaths on the rise across our state it is crucial that we work together to ensure our loved ones #GetCovered early this season.   https://t.co/2cmpkh9716

As #COVID19 continues to spread &  families struggle to keep food on the table EIP can make a big difference.   Today my House colleagues & I are  teaming up with @IRSnews to raise awareness & ensure people who normally don’t file taxes register before the Nov 21 deadline. https://t.co/cwEVRCXHAs

There’s just over one month left to #GetCovered under the 2021 Affordable Care Act open enrollment period.   With COVID-19 cases rising rapidly and flu season underway it’s never been more important to ensure our loved ones #GetCovered early this season.  https://t.co/2cmpkh9716

I look forward to working with President-elect @JoeBiden and Vice President-elect @KamalaHarris to advance policies that will combat climate change protect people with pre-existing conditions control the COVID-19 pandemic and provide a better future for all Americans.

Today is the FIRST day of open enrollment and as #COVID19 continues to spike it’s never been more important to #GetCovered.   Visit https://t.co/MC1p187lPb before December 15th to enroll change or renew health care plans under the Affordable Care Act. https://t.co/WgCYXecYsi

Last week I met with some of our incredible small business community—folks who’ve worked tirelessly to keep their doors open customers safe & employees on payroll.  With #COVID19 cases spiking I’m committed to getting them the resources to get through these challenging times. https://t.co/Z3oDk5Tmgu

So far my team and I have resolved over 1029 cases for folks across our community.   We’ve helped our constituents obtain earned benefits like Social Security & Medicare small business owners seeking #COVID19 relief and families in need of help with visas and immigration. https://t.co/rNu7naNcCm

After more than 5 months of inaction by @SenateGOP one of every seven small businesses has shut down permanently.  How many more folks will have to lose their livelihoods before @SenateMajLdr takes up the House’s #COVID19 relief package? https://t.co/URvVqVJeLF

ATTN Illinoisans who work for or volunteer with social service organizations food banks or agencies helping individuals experiencing homelessness.  At 10 am CT the IRS will host a Webinar to help you reach folks who have not yet received their COVID-19 Economic Impact Payment. https://t.co/tFCf6POG4n

Our economic recovery hinges on #COVID19 relief sufficient to:   1. Save lives & get the virus under control   2. Ensure families & small businesses can stay afloat  The House passed two rounds of relief  to do just that. @SenateGOP and the President continue to block both. https://t.co/k7Db56qwV7

The President is recovering from #COVID19 after receiving the best health care imaginable (paid for by taxpayers) but he’s fighting tooth and nail to take away yours.   The President made certain his own business got federal relief but today he shut the door on yours. https://t.co/BuxinO6zCN

While the ceremony was originally  planned for March and postponed due to #COVID19 today was a reminder that with simple precautions like mask wearing and social distancing we can still come together as a community.    Watch here ➡️ https://t.co/pJzl36f5dW

This pandemic is far from over. Democrat or Republican it’s time we all work together to keep each other safe.   Wear a mask Get a flu shot  Wash your hands Listen to the science  And do your best to social distance  https://t.co/3QNojyGsQ1

In Illinois our teachers have shown incredible selflessness & have risen to challenge after challenge posed by #COVID19.   This #WorldTeacherDay we owe our educators more than gratitude.   That starts with passing the updated #HeroesAct providing $225B for education nationwide.

Bottom line we won’t get our economy back on track until we pass #COVID19 relief sufficient to:   1. Protect American lives & get the virus under control   2. Ensure families & small businesses have the resources necessary to stay afloat.   Our relief bill will do exactly that.

As our community continues to feel the economic burden of #COVID19 it’s imperative that Congress gets help to those in need.   It has been over 4 months since the first package passed the House – it’s time Mitch McConnell & @SenateGOP put the lives of the American people first.

Our updated #COVID19 relief package also includes:   $225 billion for education.   $57 billion to support child care for families.   $12.1 billion for Illinois to help first responders frontline health workers teachers & other essential workers.

With jobless claims topping 837K last week & >200K lives lost it’s clear this crisis is far from over.   Tonight I voted for the updated Heroes Act comprehensive legislation to combat #COVID19 stabilize our economy and support families workers & small businesses.

Social media companies need to be doing more to stop spread of this kind of misinformation.   I led a letter earlier this year demanding social media platforms to do more to stop the deadly COVID-19 misinformation online.  https://t.co/eo0i5dWmGT

#COVID continues to kill 1000 Americans daily—stunting our economic recovery and putting our children’s education & safety at risk.   Peddled by our own President misinformation is costing lives costing folks their jobs and keeping us from our loved ones.
A study by @Cornell found that Trump is the ‘Single Largest Driver’ of Coronavirus misinformation.  https://t.co/DQ7JwEfvgZ

Flu shots save lives every year but this year getting yours will be essential to protecting our vulnerable neighbors & ensuring our nurses & doctors can focus on fighting #COVID19.   Uninsured residents of DuPage county can get theirs free @DHCoalition https://t.co/bxrFAjSfX9 https://t.co/8lpW3YD0Nb

The #COVID19 pandemic threatens to wipe out years of progress we’ve made toward ending the opioid epidemic.   It’s more important now than ever than we #SupportFamilies and provide funding for support services. #HR5572

With #COVID19 threatening lives and our shot at economic recovery a #ClimateCrisis devastating communities and jeopardizing the stability of our financial system and a justice system that’s failing Black Americans the stakes are higher than ever. https://t.co/0pbfkhCTU7

PSA: @DHCoalition is partnering with Walgreens to offer free flu shots to uninsured or low-income residents of DuPage County.   Flu shots save lives every year but right now they’re essential to ensuring our hospitals can focus on fighting #COVID19.  https://t.co/kh1iNGKVC0

We’ve now lost over 200000 American lives to #COVID19–over four times more than the Vietnam war.   They were mothers fathers sons and daughters beloved members of their communities and so much more than numbers on a page. #COVIDMemorialProject https://t.co/3jNf1C9ZDI

For many families including my own the start of school looks much different this year due to #COVID19 restrictions.   ICYMI: I recently hosted a webinar with @smithsonian & @librarycongress to discuss free educational resources for teachers & parents. https://t.co/RQOq2MCXhw

Over the past several months COVID-19 has plunged our nation into a worker safety crisis and the Trump administration has failed to act.   This #LaborDay is a reminder that we must stand up for workers’ right to safe workplaces.

In Illinois and across America testing is absolutely imperative to safely reopening the economy restarting schools and addressing #COVID19 hot spots.   Read our full letter here ➡️  https://t.co/35Z9sk9aiN

NEW: @SenatorDurbin @SenDuckworth @RodneyDavis and I led a bipartisan letter to @SecAzar @HHSGov urging federal resources to support the expansion of SHIELD T3 an innovative system of #COVID19 testing & tracing developed by the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. 🔗⬇️

Our FY21 funding package also provides:  ✅ $8 billion for the @CDCgov  ✅ $9 billion in emergency funds to improve preparedness for public health emergencies   ✅ $78.7 billion towards surface transportation programs to support economic recovery from #COVID19
About a month ago the House passed FY21 Appropriations packages that invest in the American people and reject the Trump admin’s proposed slashing of programs critical to fighting #COVID19.

I’m particularly glad that the FY2021 package includes language requiring that @FDA and @HHS ensure the #COVID19 vaccine is safe and effective for the entire U.S. population including women and minorities.  Here’s why it matters ⬇️ https://t.co/Lyiem4YBa6

As we continue to face new & continuing challenges related to coronavirus I’m proud to have joined my House colleagues to pass the FY21 appropriations package almost a month ago—including several provisions stop the spread of #COVID19 & invest in healthcare infrastructure.

ATTN: Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! Our nation is experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/sgzIqzMMPE

#COVID19 has made a few things clear:   Our health is only as safe as our most vulnerable neighbors.   Masks work.   Protecting access to affordable health care saves lives & taxpayer dollars.    Our leaders should listen to scientists and health care workers not ignore them.

Whether you’re a professional educator teaching online or a caregiver new to this role at home there’s no doubt that educating our kids in this #COVID19 moment is challenging and often overwhelming. https://t.co/4mG0Zptq4s
✅It invests in $78.7 billion in our surface transportation programs to support economic recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic.

COVID-19 has proven that access to affordable health care is essential to keeping our families healthy our communities safe & our economy strong.   Join me at 7 pm CT on FB Live for a Community Forum on Safeguarding & Expanding Health Care. Register here: https://t.co/z36ORT3Ufd https://t.co/tx6Gqb7tBR

#Covid_19 has proven that access to affordable health care is essential to keeping our families healthy our communities safe & our economy strong.   Join me tomorrow at 7 pm CT on FB Live for a Community Forum on Safeguarding & Expanding Care   Registration link below⬇️ https://t.co/u7Z6GMYdQ0

“Like covid-19 climate change is governed by feedback loops and exponential processes; every day of delay makes the consequences more catastrophic. Conversely each action taken now will help avert even worse effects.” https://t.co/tO2GXFGUuT

“Climate scientists were probably the least surprised people in the world when the response to the coronavirus became politically polarized. Because that’s what we’ve been living through for 30 years.”  —@KHayhoe https://t.co/FvNYd5bYIQ

It’s been 92 days since the House passed the #HeroesAct. Between 160000 Americans killed by #COVID19 55 M first-time unemployment claims & 30 M at risk of eviction how many more days must families students and frontline heroes suffer while the Senate refuses to act?

We all know you can’t fight #COVID19 without testing and contact tracing.   Every day this administration fails to develop and implement a national strategy costs lives prevents economic recovery and pushes our shot at beating this virus even further out of reach.

You don’t have to be a detective to see what’s going on here.  That’s why I joined the Illinois delegation in telling Postmaster General DeJoy exactly how his changes will undermine our fight against #coronavirus & endanger the health safety & constitutional rights of millions. https://t.co/CCqFwdk3Jk

Back in July I had the chance to call Westmont Fire Chief Steve Riley to congratulate him on a $38k #COVID19 grant from DHS.   I’m proud to announce that Westmont Fire has been awarded another $181818 grant to better protect the safety of our fire fighters & our community.

Aside from lobbying against the #HeroesAct & legal protections for employee and customer safety ALEC is also exploiting the pandemic to gerrymander our districts privatize our public schools & curb federal #COVID19 emergency response. https://t.co/QTyPqGti5O

Then there’s ALEC’s model bill for state legislatures to create #COVID19 liability protections aimed to protect corporations from lawsuits by employees who are required to work during the coronavirus pandemic at the state and federal levels. https://t.co/MRJeVRFweK

Now for ALEC’s decades-long commitment to sabotaging health care.   Before I #ExposeALEC’s role selling out public health during #COVID19 & jeopardizing our economic recovery it’s important to understand their long history of #CopyPasteCorruption on undermining #AffordableCare. https://t.co/xeJdZfgLT3
